snippet: Médecins Sans Frontières, one of the leading providers of medical assistance to people in Rakhine State, reported that many of its local staff members were afraid to work at refugee camps there.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders reports that radical Buddhist groups are preventing doctors from delivering assistance to areas of western Myanmar affected by intense sectarian violence between Buddhists and Muslims.
lead_paragraph: Médecins Sans Frontières, one of the leading providers of medical assistance to people in Rakhine State, reported that many of its local staff members were afraid to work at refugee camps there.

headline.seo: Threats Hinder Myanmar Aid, Doctors Without Borders Says
headline.main: Charity Says Threats Foil Medical Aid in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Charity Says Threats Foil Medical Aid In Myanmar
